name: Roasted Carrots with Honey and Garlic Yogurt Sauce
description: These beauties need to be on your table! Deeply roasted rainbow carrots, swizzles of tangy garlicky yogurt sauce, a golden drizzle of honey, and festive pistachio crunches on top.
keywords: roasted carrots, rainbow carrots, honey and yogurt sauce
recipeIngredient: 1 bag (32 ounces) of rainbow carrots, peeled and sliced
1/4 teaspoon each of garlic powder, onion powder, cumin, and smoked paprika

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees. Spread the carrots out onto a large baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil. Combine the spices, salt, and pepper in a small dish and sprinkle over the carrots. Gently toss the carrots in the oil and seasoning. Roast for 20 minutes until tender and the edges are slightly charred.
Whisk together the yogurt, olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Spoon the yogurt sauce over the carrots. And finish with a drizzle of honey and a sprinkle of cilantro and pistachios.

review.reviewBody: Awesome , thank you Krista. Roasted carrots is one of the most delicious side dishes . These glazed carrots are so sweet and buttery that you'll want to eat the whole pan.)) I use  maple syrup instead of date syrup. This recipe can be made ahead of time and frozen for easy preparation.But, can you tell me please how much honey you added?
Super simple, easy and delicious! And I am not a regular carrot eater, either.  But roasted with that seasoning and  honey? Oh yeah.
These carrots are amazing!!  They look great and they are easy and delicious!!  This is another keeper!

FAN FAVE AT CHRISTMAS EVE DINNER! 
Made these for the first time yesterday for Christmas Eve dinner. Huge success! Everyone loved them. I should have made way way more!! Will def make again.
This was hands down the fave side dish from our friendsmas this year. Yogurt sauce went perfectly with the sweetness of the carrots. Definitely a worthy repeat!
These were delicious and so easy! I didn’t have yogurt so just topped with honey, pistachios, and mint!

Sexy carrots! So much going on…sweet, tender, charred, tangy, more sweet, nutty and salty, herby.

Here’s my true confession, where I switched things up a bit. Didn’t have any yogurt, so I thinned a little mayo with some lemon juice. Then forgot about the garlic. Worked perfectly well, but I can’t wait to try with garlicky yogurt. 

Thanks for this great recipe that elevates boring old carrots to superstar status. Sometimes the only veg in my fridge is a bag of carrots, and now I’ll always look forward to those days!

Omg this dish is so me. I made it and everyone loved it. Great flavors. It was something like I would order at a Mediterranean  or Israeli restaurant. The presentation is gorgeous. So easy to prepare. I used fage nonfat Greek yogurt and it was so delicious.  Make this for your next dinner party and you will wow everyone. Thanks so much.
I really love this recipe, especially the yoghurt sauce with the honey is a perfect combination
Since I made this for girls night the recipe has gone viral in my town. All of my gals are making it.
